unnormalised: Property registrations in Mumbai saw a 15% YoY increase in Oct’24, with over 11,000 units registered, according to data from Knight Frank India. This surge is attributed to the upcoming festive season and attractive offers from developers. The average property price in the city stands at Rs. 1.8 Cr.
normalised: Property registrations in Mumbai saw a fifteen percent Y-o-Y increase in October two thousand and twenty four, with over eleven thousand units registered, according to data from Knight Frank India. This surge is attributed to the upcoming festive season and attractive offers from developers. The average property price in the city stands at rupee one point eight crore.

unnormalised: A recent report by Anarock Property Consultants highlights that unsold inventory across the top 7 cities has decreased by 7% compared to last year. Approx. 4.3 lakh units remain unsold, valued at ₹6.6 lakh crore. MMR (Mumbai Metropolitan Region) and NCR (National Capital Region) account for the highest share of this unsold stock.
normalised: A recent report by Anarock Property Consultants highlights that unsold inventory across the top seven cities has decreased by seven percent compared to last year. Approximately four point three lakh units remain unsold, valued at rupee six point six lakh crore. M-M-R (Mumbai Metropolitan Region) and N-C-R (National Capital Region) account for the highest share of this unsold stock.

unnormalised: The Maharashtra govt. has collected revenue of ₹800 Cr from property registrations this October alone. Stamp duty rates remain unchanged at 5% in urban areas and 3% in rural areas, despite calls for a reduction from some industry bodies. Experts suggest a lower rate could boost sales further, especially in the affordable housing segment.
normalised: The Maharashtra government has collected revenue of rupee eight hundred crore from property registrations this October alone. Stamp duty rates remain unchanged at five percent in urban areas and three percent in rural areas, despite calls for a reduction from some industry bodies. Experts suggest a lower rate could boost sales further, especially in the affordable housing segment.

unnormalised: Investing in real estate requires careful consideration of various factors, including location, property type, and prevailing market conditions. Prospective buyers should also factor in registration charges, stamp duty, and other associated costs, which can amount to a significant portion of the total property value. Check 99acres or Magicbricks for more info.
